\section*{\begin{picture}(20,0) \put(-5,-10){\includegraphics*[width=1cm]{/www/erowid.org/experiences/images/erologo_1cm_600dpi_greyscale}} \end{picture} Erowid Experience Vaults Report Id: 45933}

\subsection*{Hostility}
\vspace{-0.2cm}
by \emph{DrStrange}
\vspace{0.5cm}
\thispagestyle{plain}

\setlength{\parskip}{1ex}
\begin{tabular}[h]{|c|c|c|c|c|}
\hline
Dose:  T+ 0:00 & 5.0 mg & oral & Pharms - Selegeline & liquid\\
\hline
\end{tabular}

\vspace{1mm}

\begin{tabular}[h]{|c|c|}
\hline
Body weight: & 125.00 lbs\\
\hline
\end{tabular}

\vspace{2mm}
Decided to give selegiline/deprenyl a try for depression which I've had forever.  One drop = 1 mg from the vendor I used.  Their instructions for depression were 5 drops am and pm.  Fortunately I started w/ one drop per day and added on drop every few days.  Each increase made me feel a bit more `pushed' and speedy.  No decrease in depression but a marked increase in irritability.  



Suddenly realized after a day at 5 drops in the am that I was frequently fighting the urge to slap someone or throw something/anything through a window or better still a wall.  Hmmm.  Guess more dopamine isn't what I need.  YMMV

\end{document}
